title: Rabbit Every Monday/A Mouse Divided/Tree For Two
desc: Bugs introduces many of his co-hosts individually: Pepe Le Pew, Yosemite Sam, Tweety, Sylvester and Speedy Gonzales. But Daffy Duck can't convince Bugs to introduce him as well, try as he might during the show.

title: Putty Tat Trouble/Wise Quackers/Speedy Gonzales
desc: Rocky and Mugsy try to grab up some of the money from the sponsors of the show by going into the television business themselves, intruding on the proceedings in the process.

title: Wild Over You/Go Fly a Kit/Mouse-Warming
desc: The midget gangster Baby Faced Finster dresses up as a baby to escape the police. To his dismay, he ends up in the hands of Bugs Bunny, who treats him as a baby.

title: To Itch His Own/Gee Whiz-z-z-z!/Whoa, Be-Gone!
desc: Wile E. Coyote's chase of the Road Runner has extended into the studio where Bugs is trying to host his television show. Two Road Runner cartoons are thus featured, involving Wile E.'s schemes.

title: Canary Row/Knights Must Fall/For Scent-imental Reasons
desc: Desperate to appear on the show as the guest, Daffy dresses as a Hawaiian, a musketeer, and a knight, but his costume is deemed inappropriate by Bugs for each cartoon about to commence.

title: Long-Haired Hare/Sandy Claws/Mouse Wreckers
desc: In a musical competition between cartoon features of Bugs at war with an opera singer, Sylvester buffeted by tidal waves in his gastronomic quest for Tweety, and two mice conspiring to induce house cat insanity, Daffy plays the drums.

title: Bully For Bugs/Tweety's S.O.S./One Froggy Evening
desc: Daffy disguises himself as Bugs to host the television show, but a sheepdog, on a day free from his work, walks into the studio, hoping to catch the bunny-rabbit (Bugs) that he saw on television on the previous week.

title: My Bunny Lies Over the Sea/Scaredy Cat/Scent-imental Romeo
desc: Daffy wants to be host. So, he banishes all others from the stage, including Pepe, Elmer, and Bugs. Still, the cartoons proceed on schedule, with Bugs in Scotland, Porky and Sylvester in a spooky, mouse-infested house.

title: Bunker Hill Bunny/Each Dawn I Crow/Golden Yeggs
desc: Tweety is host of an installment containing two psychological thrillers with birds seemingly doomed to death at a specified time. So that the little canary can be safe from Sylvester, Bugs hangs his cage from the stage ceiling.

title: Which is Witch/Mouse Mazurka/Kit For Cat
desc: Yosemite Sam wants Bugs' hide. So, gun in hand, he comes to see The Bugs Bunny Show live as a spectator in the studio.

title: Two's a Crowd/All a Bir-r-r-d/The Hasty Hare
desc: Bugs introduces Porky Pig as host. Porky is pestered by Charlie Dog, who is looking for a master. Charlie does his all-breeds-in-one routine and complicates Porky's introduction.

title: What's Up, Doc?/Early to Bet/Pop 'im Pop!
desc: George P. Dog is introduced by Bugs as the emcee for the show, but Foghorn Leghorn decides that he would be a better emcee and pushes the dog aside.

title: A-Lad-in His Lamp/Dog Gone South/A Fractured Leghorn
desc: Sylvester is introduced by Bugs as host, and he is joined on stage by his son, Sylvester Jr., who is underwhelmed at Sylvester's all-too-brief introduction of him.

title: Ant Pasted/The Fair-Haired Hare/I Gopher You
desc: Elmer Fudd is host and tries to sing, but he is thwarted when the notes on his sheet music run off of their page and remind him of his July 4 picnic that became a harrowing confrontation.

title: Rocket Squad/Daffy Dilly/Drip-Along Daffy
desc: Daffy finally receives recognition. Bugs hosts an all-Daffy Duck tribute, in which Mama Bear performs "I'm Just Wild About Daffy" and the mallard stars in cartoons as a far-future detective.

title: The Leghorn Blows at Midnight/His Bitter Half/Hot Cross Bunny
desc: Foghorn Leghorn introduces Miss Prissy, who, Foghorn says, is an old-time actress.

title: Lovelorn Leghorn/Who's Kitten Who?/The Windblown Hare
desc: An unseen animator sketches Foghorn Leghorn with Rock Hudson's body and then draws a broom's tail on Foghorn's backside. Foghorn retaliates by lassoing and pummeling the animator- Daffy Duck.

title: High Diving Hare/Don't Give Up the Sheep/Stooge For a Mouse
desc: Two lame-brained Mexicali cats, Jose and Miguel, try to host an episode with Yosemite Sam plummeting again and again into a bucket of water, Ralph Wolf being continually stopped from obtaining mutton by the omnipresent Sam Sheepdog.

title: High Diving Hare/Don't Give Up the Sheep/Stooge For a Mouse
desc: Bugs demonstrates how to draw an animated cartoon character. He decides to use Daffy Duck as an example and draws Daffy from a dumbbell.

title: Rabbit of Seville/The Scarlet Pumpernickel/Stop! Look! And Hasten!
desc: Bugs tries to indulge the audience in a bit of culture, such as in his own rendition of the opera, "The Barber of Seville", in spite of constant interruptions from Elmer Fudd.

title: Hillbilly Hare/Hippety Hopper/You Were Never Duckier
desc: Mac and Tosh, the Goofy Gophers, are introduced by Bugs as the host. In the cartoons, Bugs orchestrates a square dance that very much pains two lame-brained men of the Ozark Mountains.

title: The Turn-Tale Wolf/Paying the Piper/Beanstalk Bunny
desc: Sylvester is host and tells to his son, Junior, the Looney Tune-style fairy tales of the Big Bad Wolf and the Three Little Pigs- in which hero and villain roles are seemingly reversed.

title: Big House Bunny/Canned Feud/Home, Tweet Home
desc: Mac and Tosh, the Goofy Gophers, are again hosts for the show. They spend their time politely arguing over who should introduce the jailed Bugs, house-imprisoned and in-need-of-food Sylvester, and Tweety-in-a-city-park.

title: Mississippi Hare/Terrier-Stricken/Cheese Chasers
desc: Yosemite Sam wants to be the show emcee this time around, but Bugs chooses Pepe Le Pew instead, much to Sam's chagrin.

title: Henhouse Henery/Curtain Razor/Devil May Hare
desc: Bugs introduces Daffy Duck as this installment's host, but Daffy is backstage being chased by the Tasmanian Devil, who has broken out of a crate.

title: Hare We Go/The Foghorn Leghorn/Little Red Rodent Hood
desc: Okay, rabbit. Grab a cloud. This is a stick-up." Gun-toting gangsters Rocky and Mugsy hijack the show. Mugsy escorts Bugs off of the stage, and Rocky introduces the cartoons.

title: Bad-Time Story
desc: It is "Reading Out Loud Night", and Bugs selects a book from a shelf and walks into a backdrop leading into the first cartoon feature for this fairy tales and legends installment.

title: Satan's Waitin'
desc: Yosemite Sam dies after being crushed by a falling safe during his evil scheme to divest a widow of her money and he goes to hell, where the devil promises to release Sam's spirit, provided that Sam bring to the devil a certain rabbit.

title: Daffy Doodling
desc: Daffy outwits Bugs for the position of emcee, Sylvester and a brawny, stupid sidekick hunt mice in a warehouse, the Goofy Gophers find that their lumber-harvested home tree has been converted into human furniture.

title: Omni-Puss
desc: Bugs Bunny lectures about cats, describing with visual aid an alley cat, a Bob Cat greeting a Tom Cat, a pole cat, two Persian cats making a Persian-to-Persian telephone call, etc..

title: Tired and Feathered
desc: Bugs Bunny gives a lecture on birds.

title: Man's Best Friend
desc: Bugs Bunny lectures about dogs, but first must struggle with a projectionist who, when Bugs says that the lecture is about man's best friend, shows a picture of a tarantula and then a Whistler's Mother portrait.

title: Ball Point Puns
desc: Red and black dancing pens, named Penelope and Penbroke, perform like figure skaters on paper provided by Bugs.

title: The Unfinished Symphony
desc: Bugs contends with an annoying fly in this musical show, featuring a mouse who can play a miniature piano, Bugs' conducting of an orchestra's performance of "Morning, Noon, and Night in Vienna" by Franz Von Suppe.

title: Prison to Prison
desc: Bugs, dressed like the portly Alfred Hitchcock, lectures on crime.

title: Go Man Go
desc: The subject for tonight's show is one that has always puzzled us little denizens of the woodland glades." In yet another lecture, Bugs talks about man.

title: I'm Just Wild About Hare
desc: Bugs has overslept. When the announcer summons him by hole-shaped elevator to the stage, either he is in his bathrobe, barely awake and brushing his teeth, or he is drying himself after a shower, or he is occupied with his vacuum cleaner.

title: Stage Couch
desc: Sylvester needs psychiatric help when his frustration at being unable to catch Tweety has him on the verge of mental collapse.

title: Do or Diet
desc: The Tasmanian Devil is Bugs' guest on this episode, in which the rabbit prescribes a carrot diet to the beast.

title: Hare Brush
desc: Introduced by Bugs, Harry the Brush explains his role in the animation of cartoons wherein Claude Cat schemes to implicate bulldog Marc Antony.

title: Is This a Life?
desc: In this spoof of This is Your Life, Bugs Bunny's life is reviewed, with visits from friends and foes.

title: De-Duck-Tive Story
desc: Daffy recounts many of his detective escapades.

title: The Astro-Nuts
desc: Bugs Bunny emerges from his hole on stage as Super-Rabbit, defender of the defenseless, buddy of the buddy-less, to introduce science fiction cartoons.

title: Vera's Cruise
desc: Sylvester recounts his recent travels through Europe, when his pursuit of Tweety became transoceanic and transcontinental.

title: Foreign Legion Leghorn
desc: Foghorn Leghorn's farmyard life has been so tough on him that he decides to enlist in the French Foreign Legion.

title: Watch My Line
desc: The art of cartoon drawing is demonstrated by an animator, whom Bugs instructs to draw a line, which turns into different things.

title: What's Up Dog?
desc: A second look at dogs, hosted by Bugs.

title: The Cat's Bah
desc: Pepe Le Pew recalls the results of broken romances in Africa. He suggests that viewers "take a brief respite from romance" by joining Bugs Bunny, whose Miami Beach vacation went afoul.

title: No Business Like Slow Business
desc: Slowpoke Rodriguez and Speedy Gonzales are co-hosts, introducing cartoons in which Sylvester and the Big Bad Wolf team to stalk Tweety and Little Red Riding Hood in the house of Granny.

title: The Honeymousers
desc: A great spoof of the 1950's TV show, "The Honeymooners", starring Daws Butler as the voices of both the "Ralph Kramden" and "Ed Norton" characters, and June Foray as both "Alice Kramden" and "Trixie Norton"

title: A Star Is Bored
desc: Bugs provides yet another lecture on cartoon animation, secretly stating that he does the voice of Mel Blanc. Daffy, meanwhile, tries to upstage the rabbit in the guise of a clean-up artist from a cartoon agency.

title: A Tale of Two Kitties
desc: Sylvester and son discuss mice, ranging from those from Mexico to those of the "giant" variety.

title: Terrier-Stricken/Dog Gone South/Devil May Hare
desc: Bugs introduces Porky Pig as the host for the show. Porky is pestered by Charlie Dog, who is looking for a master.

title: The Windblown Hare/Don't Give Up the Sheep/Stooge for a Mouse
desc: After starring in a cartoon as the temporary straw-and-wood-house-buying dupe of Three wolf-wary and dishonest Little Pigs, Bugs lectures about dogs, but first must struggle with a projectionist.

title: Barbary-Coast Bunny/Henhouse Henery/Canned Feud
desc: Bugs Bunny introduces the host for this show, Pepe Le Pew, who is in an apartment in Paris.

title: Hare We Go/A Waggily Tale/Just Plane Beep
desc: Wile E. Coyote's chase of the Road Runner has extended into the studio where Bugs is trying to host his television show.

title: Dr. Devil and Mr. Hare/Who's Kitten Who?/Heaven Scent
desc: Desperate to appear on the show as the feature performer, Daffy dresses as a Hawaiian, a musketeer, and a knight, but his costume is deemed inappropriate by Bugs for each cartoon about to commence.

title: Mad as a Mars Hare/Tweety's S.O.S./Chaser On the Rocks
desc: In a musical competition between cartoon features of Bugs at war with an opera singer, Sylvester buffeted by tidal waves in his gastronomic quest for Tweety.

title: No Parking Hare/Mississippi Hare/Little Beau Pep√©
desc: Daffy disguises himself as Bugs to host the television show, but a sheepdog, on a day free from his work, walks into the studio, hoping to catch the bunny-rabbit (Bugs) that he saw on television on the previous week.

desc: Tweety is host of an installment containing two psychological thrillers with birds seemingly doomed to death at a specified time.

desc: Yosemite Sam wants Bugs' hide. So, gun in hand, he comes to see The Bugs Bunny Show live as a spectator in the studio.

desc: Bugs introduces Porky Pig as host. Porky is pestered by Charlie Dog, who is looking for a master.

title: Transylvania 6-5000/Each Dawn I Crow/One Froggy Evening

title: A Fractured Leghorn/High Note/Hot Cross Bunny
desc: Bugs Bunny is a science research test subject for the switching of his brain with a chicken. He finds himself in front of an audience in a lab auditorium and decides to entertain them with impersonations, magic tricks, dancing and skat-singing.
